messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conference question
messages.msgSnippet: There is a homeschooling conference south of Chicago in July that seems pretty all inclusive. It is The Link Homeschool Conference on July 21-23rd in
messages.messageBody:
There is a homeschooling conference south of Chicago in July that seems
pretty all inclusive. It is The Link Homeschool Conference on July
21-23rd in Bourbonnais, IL. There look to be some very interesting
programs for children and adults. For info you can check the web site
www.homeschoolnewslink.com or e-mail them at MBL17@...

Also thanks to everyone for all of the food discussions. It has been
like a light bulb going on in my head. I checked out some books at the
library and am now preparing to get rid of the crap in my kitchen.

Shelley in Lake Villa, IL

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conference question

writes:

<< This may be too much to hope for. but are there going to be any
unschooling conferences in the midwest ? >>

I'd like to know, too; I live in So. Ind. ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] conference question
messages.msgSnippet: There is an inclusive homeschooling conference in Colorado, with Mary Griffiths as chief speaker, sometime in late August.  And something brewing in South
messages.messageBody:
There is an inclusive homeschooling conference in Colorado, with Mary
Griffiths as chief speaker, sometime in late August. And something
brewing in South Dakota, though certainly not just unschoolers.

Anyone else know of others?

David

Dia Garland wrote:

> This may be too much to hope for. but are there going to be any
> unschooling conferences in the midwest? Dia

"And the Skylark Sings with Me" is to homeschooling what Tom Paine's
"Common Sense" was to the American Revolution."--Greg Bates, Common
Courage Press. To read a sample chapter or the foreword, and to get
information about ordering a signed copy, visit www.skylarksings.com or
send an e-mail to shantinik@...
